page.title: 05Stetfold Rocks Farm,Exford
page.content: The Tucker family first rented the farm in the 1890's.The farm is 700 acres,with a 16 room stone house 2 to 300 years old.Opposite the house stands a courtyard of stone buildings with a wooden granary, on stilts,dated 1860's.John Tucker works on the farm with two other full time workers and one part time.They run a flock of 800 ewes,Exmoor horns and Border Leicesters,plus 20 rams.Also a herd of 250 cows plus calves,pure Devon and Hereford, a Devon bull and a Jersey cow which supplies milk to the house. Other stock includes 4 sheep dogs,9 cats,and 35 hens.The sandy loam soil grows corn,hay,grass,silage and roots, all worked with the help of 4 tractors and other modern equipment,plus a 70" rainfall.
